hints.label: thm-weinhold-ruppeiner-conformal
hints.title: Weinhold-Ruppeiner Conformal Duality
hints.content:
2595: :label: thm-weinhold-ruppeiner-conformal
2596: 
2597: The Weinhold and Ruppeiner metrics are **conformally equivalent** with temperature as the conformal factor:
2598: 
2599: $$
2600: g_W^{UU} = T \cdot g_R^{UU}
2601: $$
2602: 
2603: More generally, for the full metric tensor:
2604: 
2605: $$
2606: g_W = T \cdot g_R
2607: $$
2608: 
2609: where the relationship holds component-wise in the appropriate coordinate systems after proper Legendre transformation.

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-94
hints.title: Geometric Interpretation
hints.content:
2686: :class: tip
2687: 
2688: **Conformal geometry**: Two metrics $g$ and $\tilde{g}$ are conformally related if $\tilde{g} = e^{2\sigma} g$ for some scalar field $\sigma$. Here:
2689: 
2690: $$
2691: g_W = e^{\sigma} g_R \quad \text{with } e^{\sigma} = T
2692: $$
2693: 
2694: **Physical meaning**:
2695: - $g_R$ measures thermodynamic distance in "natural units" (entropy)
2696: - $g_W$ measures the same distance in "energy units" (internal energy)
2697: - Temperature converts between the two: high $T$ → large energy fluctuations for fixed entropy fluctuations
2698: 
2699: **Curvature**: Conformal transformations preserve angles but not lengths. Importantly, in 2D, curvature scales as:
2700: 
2701: $$
2702: R_W = e^{-\sigma} R_R = \frac{1}{T} R_R
2703: $$
